## 3.1 Binomial distribution

#### Step 1
Specify $p$ and $N$  
$p$ = 0.1  
$N$ = 7  

#### Step 2
Find $p(k,N)$ from equation 3.47
$$p(0, N) = (1 - p)^N$$
$$p(0,N) = (1-0.1)^7 = (0.9)^7 = 0.47$$

#### Step 3 
Find $p(k,N)$ from equation 3.48 (I will use dbinom... but I assume this is cheating?)
```{r}
k <- c(1:7) 
k <- as.data.frame(k)

results <- as.data.frame(apply(k, 2, dbinom, size=7, prob=0.1)) %>% select(p=k) %>% cbind(k) %>% select(k,p)
```
